snippet: Fledgling citizen militias have taken on the task of standing up to an array of Islamist fighters bent on enforcing a hard-edged brand of Shariah law in Mali.
abstract: Fledgling citizen militias have taken on the task of standing up to an array of Islamist fighters bent on enforcing a hard-edged brand of Shariah law in Mali; given the internal discord in the Malian army and its reluctance to take on the Islamists, the army has been only too willing to embrace the nascent militias, feeding them, providing instruction and even allowing them to shelter and train on abandoned state lands.
lead_paragraph: Fledgling citizen militias have taken on the task of standing up to an array of Islamist fighters bent on enforcing a hard-edged brand of Shariah law in Mali.
